resources.string:
USB Type C specifies that any USB A to C cable has a 56kOhm resistor.\n\n
This resistor tells your phone how much voltage the cable is capable of supplying by default, and by reading the maximum allowed amperage of the USB chipset should allow us to estimate whether your cable happens to be Type-C compliant.

There was an error reading your phone\'s USB power supply.\n\n
Press here to email me some debugging output so I can try to support your device too!
